tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 areas where you can apply them to your current work, focusing on UX Fundamentals. Document your findings in a 2-page report.

Create a simple wireframe of a common UI element (e.g., button, form field) using the 8-point grid system. Focus on symmetry and balance. Measure your design's adherence to these principles and calculate the score gap for this task.

Conduct a self-assessment of your current UX Fundamentals knowledge. Create a list of 5 areas where you feel uncertain or need improvement, and research one area in-depth using the Laws of UX website (lawsofux.com)
Apply Occam's Razor to a recent design project. Identify 3 assumptions you made about your users and test them through user research or validation. Document your findings in a 2-page report.

Create a persona for a common user type (e.g., young adult, senior citizen) using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Focus on understanding their pain points and motivations. Measure your design's adherence to these principles and calculate the score gap for this task.
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system. Focus on simplicity and clarity. Measure your design's adherence to these principles and calculate the score gap for this task.

Conduct a user interview with someone from your target audience (e.g., young adult, senior citizen) using the Zeigarnik Effect. Focus on understanding their pain points and motivations. Document your findings in a 2-page report.

Create a heuristic evaluation of a recent design project using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com). Identify areas where you can improve usability and document your findings in a 2-page report.

Apply Aesthetic-Usability Effect to a recent design project. Focus on creating an intuitive and visually appealing design. Measure your design's adherence to these principles and calculate the score gap for this task.
Create a comprehensive UX Fundamentals plan, outlining specific goals and strategies for improvement. Document your plan in a 2-page report.

Conduct a user research project using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Focus on understanding your users' pain points and motivations. Measure your design's adherence to these principles and calculate the score gap for this task.

Redesign a complex UI element (e.g., login form, payment gateway) using the 8-point grid system. Focus on simplicity and clarity. Measure your design's adherence to these principles and calculate the score gap for this task.

resources.readup: As a Practitioner UX designer, you have the power to shape user experiences and drive business success. Focus on building your skills in User Research & Validation, Product Thinking & Strategy, and Collaboration & Communication to unlock your full potential and become a sought-after expert in the field.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Mastering Usability Heuristics for Effective Design
topics.summary: Applying usability heuristics will improve your design decisions and user experience outcomes.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing products using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design and identify areas for improvement in each product's design.
Create a comprehensive guide to applying Occam’s Razor, Zeigarnik Effect, Miller’s Law, Jakob’s Law, and Serial Position Effect in UX design.
Design an interactive prototype using Figma that incorporates 3 usability heuristics (e.g., visibility of system status, error prevention, and user control) and test it with real users.

topics.name: Developing a Deep Understanding of User Research
topics.summary: Conducting effective user research is crucial for creating user-centered designs.
practice_points: Conduct 2 in-depth interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings, then analyze and present insights to stakeholders.
Create a comprehensive user research plan for a hypothetical product, including participant recruitment strategies, data collection methods, and analysis techniques.
Analyze existing user research studies (e.g., those published on UX Collective or ResearchGate) and extract actionable insights for your own design work.

topics.name: Enhancing Collaboration and Communication Skills
topics.summary: Effective collaboration and communication are essential for successful UX projects.
practice_points: Participate in a virtual design workshop with 3-4 colleagues, where you'll work on a shared project and practice active listening, clear communication, and constructive feedback.
Create a comprehensive collaboration guide for your team, including best practices for remote work, conflict resolution, and stakeholder management.
Conduct 2 usability testing sessions with stakeholders (e.g., product managers or business owners) to gather feedback on your design decisions and iterate accordingly.
